meanings.definition: An amount equal to half of a whole
meanings.sent1: I ate only half of the cookie.
meanings.sent2: She cut the sandwich in half to share with her friend.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the vase, spilling water everywhere. It was a half-hearted attempt at playing.
meanings.sent4: His smile was only half genuine, hiding his true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The sun set, casting half the sky in a warm orange glow.

meanings.definition: One of two equal parts of something
meanings.sent1: He took one half of the pizza, leaving the other half for his sister.
meanings.sent2: The team celebrated their victory, each player receiving a half of the trophy.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved pulling a rabbit out of a hat, but only half of the rabbit appeared.
meanings.sent4: The old house was split in half by the lightning strike, revealing a hidden room.
meanings.sent5: The mirror reflected only half of her face, creating an eerie effect.

meanings.definition: To divide into two equal parts
meanings.sent1: She will half the cake so that everyone gets a fair share.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to half the apples among themselves.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to half the acorn, but ended up dropping it.
meanings.sent4: The chef carefully halved the recipe to make a smaller portion.
meanings.sent5: The river seemed to half the forest, creating a natural divide.
